The Popish Plot of 1678 sparked renewed interest in the Gunpowder Plot, resulting in a book by Thomas Barlow, Bishop of Lincoln, which refuted "a bold and groundless surmise that all this was a contrivance of Secretary Cecil".
data.fullContent: Many at the time felt that Salisbury had been involved in the plot to gain favor with the King and enact more stridently anti-Catholic legislation. Such conspiracy theories alleged that Salisbury had either actually invented the plot or allowed it to continue when his agents had already infiltrated it, for the purposes of propaganda. The Popish Plot of 1678 sparked renewed interest in the Gunpowder Plot, resulting in a book by Thomas Barlow, Bishop of Lincoln, which refuted "a bold and groundless surmise that all this was a contrivance of Secretary Cecil".
data.answer: 当时很多人都认为索尔兹伯里参与了阴谋，目的是为了赢得国王的好感，并颁布更为尖锐的反天主教法案。这些阴谋论声称，索尔兹伯里要么实际上捏造了这个阴谋，要么在他的特工已经渗透进去的情况下，让它继续下去，以达到宣传的目的。1678年教皇的阴谋再次激起了人们对火药阴谋的兴趣，导致林肯主教托马斯·巴洛(Thomas Barlow)写了一本书，驳斥了“这一切都是塞西尔秘书策划的大胆而毫无根据的猜测”。
